Posts.Content: RedRoses2 wrote: Is it normal to have drainage off and on after rad and my TE replacement with Silicone/fat graphing in June 2016? PS recommends the LD flap, so it gets the radiated skin out and gives the best look. But that scares me. At this point I dont care about the look if no one can tell me what the problem is. Has anyone had the LD flap to correct complications from radiation? Is it possible to have no complications from the LD? Dx 3/17/2015, DCIS, Right, 2cm, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+ Surgery 4/26/2015 Lymph node removal: Sentinel; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Radiation Therapy 12/5/2015 Whole-breast: Breast Surgery 6/27/2016 Reconstruction (left): Fat grafting, Silicone implant; Reconstruction (right): Fat grafting, Silicone implant Surgery 12/29/2016 Reconstruction (right): Silicone implant Surgery Reconstruction (right): Latissimus dorsi flap, Silicone implant Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: After Radiation effects and complications RedRoses2 RedRoses2
